<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.56</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Eden Editor </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Mission Information </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns all entities within specific [[Eden Editor]] layer. To be used when the scenario is running, not in the editor workspace.

Useful for disabling / enabling whole parts of the scenario which you add to specific layer while editing.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Default layers are not returned.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getMissionLayerEntities]] layerName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> layerName: [[String]] - Layer name in the editor. If multiple layers with the same name are present in the scenario, the first found one is used. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Array]] in format <code>[objects:Array, markers:Array]</code> </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_base = [[getMissionLayerEntities]] "Base";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[waitUntil]] {([[player]] [[distance]] _someObject) > 800};
{
	[[deleteVehicle]] [[_x]];
} [[forEach]] (([[getMissionLayerEntities]] "Simple Objects") [[select]] 0); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Deletes all objects within that layer after the player is over 800m away from _someObject</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_layer1337Entities = [[getMissionLayerEntities]] 1337;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[getMissionLayerEntities]] layerID </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layerID: [[Number]] - Layer ID in the editor.</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] in format <code>[objects:Array, markers:Array]</code> </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[get3DENLayerEntities]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server </value></part><part><name>SERVEREXEC</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<dd class="note">
After an [[object]] was deleted from a layer, [[getMissionLayerEntities]] will return <NULL-object> for the deleted [[object]].
